name: Fairmont Chicago Millennium Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend of shopping and sightseeing. The staff was absolutely delightful, they went out of their way to see our stay was pleasant and our special requests were met. This was in addition to the clean comfortable rooms and a wonderful location. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a Chicago getaway.
reviews.title: Extraordinary Staff

reviews.text: From the moment I stepped up to the front entrance my luxury service began! I enjoyed every minute @ the fairmont! The King room was spacious and the decor chic! The coffee maker was the coolest and the bathroom is huge! I really like the separate shower, tub, and separate door for the toilet. The desserts and cheese spread at ENO so yummy. Before the fairmont the W hotel was my favorite chain of hotels to stay at.
reviews.title: FAB-U-LOUS!

reviews.text: This hotel is really a nice location - just off Mil. Park and Grank Park - a few blocks from Lake Michigan and the marina area and just blocks from the theatre district and Michigan Avenue - probably the best location I have ever stayed in Chicago... moreso - QUIET little streets surround the hotel and the views are nice.
reviews.title: A Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is contemporary and the rooms are luxurious and large in size.
reviews.title: Not worth the extra Cheddar!

reviews.text: The staff was wonderful and courteous.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience, would stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got this hotel by chance since we decided the spur of the moment to spend a nite in Chicago on 7/24/09. We went thru Priceline and was lucky to get a room at this hotel for only $69 (normal rate was around $200). The room was superb on the 29th floor with a nice king bed. Hotel is only about 1.5 blocks to Michigan Ave so the location is very convenient. Parking is very expensive at $50 a nite but we parked right next door at a selfpark for just $30. We decided to have breakfast at the hotel restaurant to save us from walking elsewhere. We ordered the buckwheat pan cakes and egg benedict. They were absolutely delicious which stunned us since we didn't expect this type of experience from a hotel restaurant especially for breakfast. Glad we didn't pick their breakfast buffet since the special menu is much better. I highly recommend this beautiful and cozy hotel for your Chicago visit.
reviews.title: Great luxury hotel with superb staff and eatery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we had come from a small bedroom in a hotel in NY the size of the room on arrival was amazing! Lovely bathroom, comfy bed, wide screen telly and the major plus was an nespresso machine in the room! The location is excellent, right by millennium park and can walk to main shopping area in about 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Great hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the quality of the food but the lobby and general ambiance of the hotel was very cool. Helpful bell boy and concierge and generally staff were lovely.
reviews.title: Underwhelming --- but great location.
Best Stay in Chicago I've Ever Had!
reviews.text: Only small complaint was a rather condensing and rude waiter in the wine bar but you cant have everything.
Overall great and would definitely recommend to a friend.
reviews.title: Near perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont Chicago for a 3-day wedding weekend trip. We had a deluxe room, which was only slightly nicer than the standard room our friends were in...nice view of Lake Michigan. We had recently signed up online (free) for FPC (Fairmont President's Club), which got us complimentary access to the fitness center / spa. The hotel and rooms are very nice, and the fitness center / locker rooms are gorgeous, but the biggest problem with the hotel are the showers, which to our understanding had been renovated in the last year. These are those rain shower head things that look pretty, and are probably pretty green friendly, but the pressure is just awful. I mean we are talking nearly impossible to get soap suds off of yourself. My solution in part was to use the fitness center showers, which were slightly better and had a handheld piece, but even these had mediocre pressure at best. Call me picky, but it is precisely the bathroom/shower that can differentiate a good hotel room from a not so good one.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay, Nice Room, Poor Shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to get away for a night and we booked through Priceline. Great location convenient to Millennium Park and Navy Pier. I asked for a view of the park, and the friendly desk attendant advised that I would have to pay for an upgrade, but he'd see what he could do. He put us on the 31st floor with a lake view instead! Much better than my request indeed.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay...great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spotless, but with the minor irritation. The magnet that holds the shower door closed was missing, so the door was slightly ajar and a bit of water got on the floor.
reviews.title: Great view from our room but a few blocks from everything!

reviews.text: We will definitely stay again!
reviews.title: Good location helpful staff, but a little shabby
Beautiful hotel, poor management
reviews.text: Nice room, warm welcome, nice bed, huge bathroom and shower area, clean, great view of Millenium Park down to Buckingham Fountain, Shedd Aquarium, etc.... (SOuth facing). Not overly spectacular. Good room service one night at about 11pm because no restaurants in the area were serving food that late. We were in Chicago for my partners birthday and I told the attendant on the phone who sent up a piece of cake with our room service. Very nice gesture.

Stayed during the Lollapalooza music festival in Grant park, for which it is well positioned. I was suprised to find that my room was available at 9:30am, which was extremely convenient. Still, the young man at reception was somewhat arrogant and lacking in manners.
reviews.title: Impressive hotel at a reasonable price

reviews.text: The room was very clean and tastefully fitted. The bed was perhaps the most comfortable I have encountered, and I had three excellent nights of sleep with no noise from other guests at all. The bathroom was also very nice and featured one of those large rainfall shower heads.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!

reviews.text: The hotel is easy to find, being located right behind the AON centre (the huge white skyscraper which has a similar design to the old world trade centre in New York). So despite being called the 'Fairmont Chicago Millennium Park', the hotel does not directly border the park.
reviews.title: Nowhere near as good as the Fairmont Lake Louise, but still a nice stay

reviews.text: Enjoyed our stay. Concierge was very helpful and gave us great recommendations.
reviews.title: Terrible service, nice room, great location, terrible service ..

reviews.text: Really enjoyed our room and it had a large luxorious bathroom.
reviews.title: Luxurious
